I've just tried, and not working for me, sadly. Main menu comes up and new game produces the same exact problem that i found here;
http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/617893-im-gonna-cry-my-skyrim-goes-to-hell/
and any load game always CTD

but i found what's wrong;

I've just unchecked Unofficial Patch in data files at skyrim launcher and everything went well in-game. good to go.

(just a theory, not that i know anything about but;) i believe the reason this happens is that skyrim launcher registers any activated .esp and .esm file with it's local address (eg. c:program filesskyrimdatamod.esp). Therefore to be able to activate/check unoffcial patch we may have to extract the contents to the exact same location that you installed the game in the first place since it has a 3rd party mod (unofficial patch) in it.

any else suggestions?

Indeed. This has worked for me as well. It must be a problem with the old Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini files.

Odd.

Found the real problem!

go to "my documents/my games/skyrim/"

and open the Skyrim.ini

if you have a "[MapMenu]" section, make sure it doesn't have the line "uLockedObjectMapLOD=1"

If it does, delete it. Your problems should be solved!

Ugh now possibly a link for the binkw32.dll?

@aaros47

That file is responsible for decoding Bink! Video files.

binkw32.dll is included in the .iso file I uploaded.

You either:

a) Deleted the file accidentally

b) Didn't extract the file correctly

c) Had a download error


Option 1: Download the file directly
http://www.dll-files.com/dllindex/dll-files.shtml?binkw32

And put it in the Skyrim game directory.

Option 2: Remove the torrent from your downloader and re-add it, set the download location to the same spot (don't override) and do a re-check (Usually a right click menu will have this option).
If the torrent finishes the re-check and is incomplete, just finish downloading.

If it finishes the re-check and is still at 100%, then simply re-install the game via the README.

@JohnHolmesII

Don't worry, just tried it then. It doesn't work. Do you have any solutions?

@Fincap

Skyrim installs a registry key with the install location.

On x64 it's at HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeBethesda SoftworksSkyrim

On x86, it's at HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREBethesda SoftworksSkyrim

You should delete that, and follow the README from usage.

@JohnHolmesII

Thanks you so much! I don't know what I would've done without you!
I'm working on a third release, with hopefully an even easier experience, so if you're willing to wait, you should.

The third release will be accompanied by a Troubleshoot program that should help to fix some common install problems. It is going well, but is unfinished.

Look for the third release (which will be patched to 1.6.89.0, with Creation Kit version 1.6.89.0, the accompanying SKSE, and a more recent Unofficial Patch) sometime after 4 July, and the Troubleshooter after that.

Hey john! I am having the same problem as fincap and dont know what hkey is, ive googled and stuff but still dont know, and also when i go push play it wont do anything aswell as nothing comes up in datafiles! please help!
Also there doesnt seem to be any sight of "skyrim.esm" in the data folder. i did install it before but deleted it like fincap. having same problem, please help.

@aeternak

Click Start

In the search box, type regedit

Navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE-> SOFTWARE-> Wow6432Node-> Bethesda Softworks-> Skyrim

or

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE-> SOFTWARE-> Bethesda Softworks-> Skyrim

and select "Installed Path".

Delete the installed path ( right click on it and delete).

Re-follow the instructions in the README.
You know, the SKSE developers don't approve of others making their files available for download. Just thought you should know.
